title: Croma Vera 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Hearty and rather complex aromas show on the nose of this bottling, including black cherry, vanilla, cocoa dust, hickory smoke and coconut. The palate is dominated by baking spice and gingerbread flavors, set against a blackberry and caramel backbone, but the impressive part is the chalky firm tannins that hold up the flavors quite nicely.

title: Carabella 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Threads of citrus, cherry, cola and chocolate weave through this tasty wine. It's medium bodied, focused and immediately accessible. The blend includes seven different clones of estate-grown fruit, and it was aged in French oak for 16 months.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Les Forges  (Meursault)
description: This is a soft wine, smooth and full with apricots and melons. Toasty wood flavors are balanced by the ripe fruit, the rich texture and light minerality. This opulent wine needs only short aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine des Valanges 2016 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)
description: Packed with fruit, this young wine is already delicious. Acidity, crisp texture, zingy orange and lemon-peel flavors all contribute to a ripe, refreshing wine. It has the lift of the vintage, bright and full of fruitiness from start to finish.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Natalia's Selection Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: This is a juicy and full-bodied white, tightly woven in oak and butterscotch. Expansive on the palate, with a depth of apple pie and nutmeg, it offers a balance of fresh acidity that complements well.

title: Domaine Gérard Thomas et Filles 2015 Le Trézin  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: Spicy and rich, this generous, single-vineyard wine is full bodied, creamy and ripe. Yellow fruits are balanced by bright acidity and a tight mineral character. It is still structured, with wood aging flavors and a juicy crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Julie Belland 2014 Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: From one of the most familiar of the Santenay premier crus, this wine still has its structure and a dry core. Around that are red cherry fruits, juicy acidity and a light touch of wood. The wine is developing well and should be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Julie Belland 2014 Les Cras  (Pommard)
description: From the lower slope of Pommard, this richly fruity wine is smooth and generous. It has a layer of tannin as well as full black fruits and a solid character. The wine is still young and needs aging. Drink from 2020.

title: Eola Hills 2015 Rosé Methode Champenoise Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Vintage dated and made in the classic Champagne method, this tasty brut is a pretty shade of copper-hued rose. It has lovely cherry fruit and ample length. Overall, a very tasty effort.

title: Flanagan 2014 Merlot (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a sanguine Old World-style wine, rounded in tannin and generously soft. Coconut, bay leaf, cherry and vanilla give it a yin and yang quality that flirts with both savory and rich flavors, finding balance despite its full-bodied concentration.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2009 Yarden Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Galilee)
description: This wine is light straw in color, with soft yet surprisingly persistent perlage. A nose of grapefruit and clementine leads the way for flavors of lemon, pineapple and grapefruit that fade into a soft brioche-flavored finish.

title: Gryphon Crest 2016 Riesling (Mosel)
description: A blend of fruit from both the Saar and the middle Mosel (vineyards surrounding Piesport and Bernkastel) this lovely value Riseling darts and dances on the palate with Margarita-like kicks of salt and lime. Just a shade off dry, its delicate sweetness lends balance to zesty acidity and a cool, mineral finish. This cuvée is also labeled under the Hooked brand.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2014 Vintage Reserve Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: A blend of 77% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot, 2% Malbec and 1% Merlot, this is a hearty sanguine red wine, with highlights of eucalyptus, peppercorn and billowy tobacco-laden tannin. Well integrated, it shows plenty of oak and inky concentration.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015  Marsannay
description: This is a floral wine, ripe and creamy. It has spice and toast from wood aging along with good acidity and impressiver richness. The wine is full-bodied, spicy, full of yellow and pear fruits. Drink from 2019

title: Mar de Frades 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: In this vintage, the wine itself is as catchy as Mar de Frades's signature blue bottle. Aromas of green melon, apple and lees are spot on for the variety. Flavors of pineapple and citrus finish with modest complexity carried by the presence of lees.

title: Marchiori & Barraud 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Perdriel)
description: This wine's blackberry, maple and creamy oak aromas introduce a tough but deep palate that's loaded with fruit and tannins. Its wild berry and plum flavors are raw, finishing with cheek-drying astringency. Give it lots of air upon opening and serve with meat or pasta. Drink through 2021.

title: Mendel 2014 Unus Red (Mendoza)
description: Rugged licorice and black fruit aromas include a note of barnyard animal in this wine. How tolerable the palate is depends on your ability to process rock-hard tannins. Its blackened berry and toast flavors are compact, feeling rough and heavily toasted through the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Clos du Chapitre Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: There is plenty of crisp acidity in this wine, with bright red fruits that come through the tannins. That makes for a juicy, firm wine, crisp and with a dry core. It will be ready to drink from 2024.

title: Pali 2015 Cargasacchi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light aromas of pomegranate, vanilla dust and sweet pastry show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are also quite subtle, with red currants, a touch of bitter cranberry and dried garden herbs.

title: Pepper Bridge 2014 Trine Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Franc (37%), Cabernet Sauvignon (34%), Merlot (15%), Malbec (9%) and Petit Verdot. Its aromas are still locked up, including its cinnamon, cedar and nutmeg notes and its brooding dark fruit. The palate packs a mouthful of black fruit flavors that show the ripeness of the vintage yet retain a sense of balance.

title: Prà 2015 Morandina  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: Made with 35% Corvina, 35% Corvinone, 23% Rondinella and 7% Oseleta, this opens with aromas of blackberry, graphite and a touch of cedar. The concentrated, savory palate delivers red plum, carob, white pepper and a hint of rhubarb alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 Schloss Marienlay Trocken Gutswein Riesling (Mosel)
description: Electric acidity lends vitality to this zesty and refreshing dry Riesling. Pristine white grapefruit and tangerine flavors are cutting and spry on the palate, lingering on an edge of salty minerality. Enjoy now for its exuberant freshness, but it should show brightly through 2020.

title: Rolling Plains 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is an impressive wine at the price point, sanguine and meaty, with medium-bodied density and highlights of cassis. Bright and well integrated, it's food friendly and ready to please a crowd.

title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2014 Expressionism Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: After 18 months in barrel (75% new), this was the last of the winery's 2014 Pinot Noirs to be released. The color is dark and vibrant, and it opens with orange peel, berry, spiced cherry and smoke notes. The expected barrel flavors are hiding, and the wine seems to dissipate rather quickly. It warrants another couple of years in bottle before drinking.

title: Scheid Vineyards 2014 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling is a decent example of a more restrained Santa Lucia Highlands wine, with aromas of crisp raspberry, hibiscus and cranberry notes alongside warming hints of vanilla and thyme. Fresh and lively flavors of tart red fruits are dusted by herbs and spice cake on the palate.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This wine has density and richness. With ripe berry fruits and generous tannins it conveys the fruitiness and richness of a Gevrey-Chambertin. It is structured as well, allowing plenty of room for aging. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Snake and Herring 2013 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: You can taste a bit of all of the varieties in this Bordeaux-style red blend. This shows red currant and raspberry notes, smoked meat, coffee, cigar box and some dusty oak. The palate is medium to full bodied, with more tangy red fruit and cigar box spice. Tight yet silky tannins wrap up this powerful yet easygoing red.

title: Technique 2016 Proprietary Red (Stags Leap District)
description: This blend is made from 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Petite Sirah and 15% Merlot. It works in its dusty bramble of succulent black cherry and licorice, ultimately presenting a satisfying, likable wine that's full bodied and richly round.

title: Viluko 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Mountain-like tannins make for a robust, powerful and concentrated palate that shows a leathery texture. Sage, black pepper and black currant spice up richer elements of dark chocolate and caramelized oak.

title: Viña Cobos 2014 Cobos Chañares Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: When Cobos gets its heavyweight Malbecs right, they're some of the best in Argentina. But in a year like 2014, when the end of the vintage was cold and rain-plagued, many of the big wines seem stunted. With its fully oaked mint, smoke and spice aromas, this delivers nothing but power. Toasted flavors of blackberry, cassis and raisin mark the hard palate, finishing short and with some heat. Age this until 2020 for best results.
